docTitle.titlePart: Black-box and Gray-box Strategies for Virtual Machine Migration

byline.docAuthor: Timothy Wood, Prashant Shenoy, Arun Venkataramani, and Mazin Yousif

front.div:
Abstract
Virtualization can provide significant benefits in data centers
by enabling virtual machine migration to eliminate hotspots.
We present Sandpiper, a system that automates the task of mon-
itoring and detecting hotspots, determining a new mapping of
physical to virtual resources and initiating the necessary mi-
grations. Sandpiper implements a black-box approach that is
fully OS-and application-agnostic and a gray-box approach
that exploits OS-and application-level statistics. We imple-
ment our techniques in Xen and conduct a detailed evaluation
using a mix of CPU, network and memory-intensive applica-
tions. Our results show that Sandpiper is able to resolve sin-
gle server hotspots within 20 seconds and scales well to larger,
data center environments. We also show that the gray-box
approach can help Sandpiper make more informed decisions,
particularly in response to memory pressure.
